title: Math-Based Project Learning to Improve Organizational Ambidexterity and Emotional Engagement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts and foundational knowledge of organizational management
context.additional_context: Course for financial professionals analyzing the balance between organizational exploration and exploitation activities mathematically, and exploring ways to enhance emotional engagement

learning_goals: Structural equation modeling can be utilized to quantitatively analyze the correlation between exploratory/exploitative activities.
In PBL projects, learners can design a mathematics-based decision-making model to strengthen ambidextrous capabilities.
The causal relationship between organizational exploration-exploitation activities and employees' emotional engagement can be represented through graphs and statistical analysis.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
